entry.string: Use database prefix in backup table create sql:
The default cache paths are entered below. Change them only if you have changed default cache directory paths. Note these should be full paths and there is no trailing slash in the path names.
Check the following carefully, and correct them if necessary.
Relative path from your root document directory to the backup directory on your server, where backup files will be created. It must be writeable chmod 777. No trailing slash.
If checked a time stamp will be added to the backup file name.
If checked the database name will prefix all table names in the backup file sql table create statements.
Line terminator - dependent on your database server environment. The *nix option should be fine for most systems. Older systems may require specific selection.
Number of columns used to list database tables
No. of columns in database table display:
Default Backup Type used with Scheduler:
This is the default backup type, used by default with the Scheduler module.
Specify how often this job should be executed
Please note that if you stop the scheduler or if it isn't triggered, these jobs will not be executed.
Should the scheduler FTP the created back-up file to another server?
You will need to have an FTP server to place the file.
Enter the full name of the server.
The unique user name for the FTP server.
Enter the password for this user.
The path on the FTP server
Enter the full name of the path. Defaults to /
You will need to have both the FTP and OpenSSL extension installed.
Please install and activate the Scheduler module to enable scheduling.
